MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.OS.Bundle AddAccount (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType, string authTokenType, string[] requiredFeatures, Android.OS.Bundle options);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle AddAccount(class Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType, string authTokenType, string[] requiredFeatures, class Android.OS.Bundle options) cil managed
abstract member AddAccount : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * string * string * string[] * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the type of account to add, will never be null
the type of auth token to retrieve after adding the account, may be null
a String array of authenticator-specific features that the added account must support, may be null
a Bundle of authenticator-specific options. It always contains AccountManager#KEY_CALLER_PID and AccountManager#KEY_CALLER_UID fields which will let authenticator know the identity of the caller.
Docs.summary: Adds an account of the specified accountType.
Docs.returns:
a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_INTENT, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_NAME and AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_TYPE of the account that was added, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error

format.a: Java documentation for android.accounts.AbstractAccountAuthenticator.addAccount(android.accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String[], android.os.Bundle).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.OS.Bundle AddAccountFromCredentials (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, Android.Accounts.Account account, Android.OS.Bundle accountCredentials);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle AddAccountFromCredentials(class Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, class Android.Accounts.Account account, class Android.OS.Bundle accountCredentials) cil managed

abstract member AddAccountFromCredentials : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * Android.Accounts.Account * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle override this.AddAccountFromCredentials : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * Android.Accounts.Account * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the account to clone, will never be null

the Bundle containing the required credentials to create the account. Contents of the Bundle are only meaningful to the authenticator. This Bundle is provided by #getAccountCredentialsForCloning(AccountAuthenticatorResponse, Account).
Docs.summary: Creates an account based on credentials provided by the authenticator instance of another user on the device, who has chosen to share the account with this user.
Docs.returns: a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.OS.Bundle ConfirmCredentials (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, Android.Accounts.Account account, Android.OS.Bundle options);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle ConfirmCredentials(class Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, class Android.Accounts.Account account, class Android.OS.Bundle options) cil managed
abstract member ConfirmCredentials : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * Android.Accounts.Account * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the account whose credentials are to be checked, will never be null
a Bundle of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Docs.summary: Checks that the user knows the credentials of an account.
Docs.returns:
a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_INTENT, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_BOOLEAN_RESULT, true if the check succeeded, false otherwise
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error

Docs.exception: if the authenticator could not honor the request due to a network error

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Android.OS.Bundle EditProperties (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType);

abstract member EditProperties : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * string -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: used to set the result for the request. If the Constants.INTENT_KEY is set in the bundle then this response field is to be used for sending future results if and when the Intent is started.
the AccountType whose properties are to be edited.
Docs.summary: Returns a Bundle that contains the Intent of the activity that can be used to edit the properties.
Docs.returns: a Bundle containing the result or the Intent to start to continue the request. If this is null then the request is considered to still be active and the result should sent later using response.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.OS.Bundle FinishSession (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType, Android.OS.Bundle sessionBundle);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle FinishSession(class Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType, class Android.OS.Bundle sessionBundle) cil managed

abstract member FinishSession : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle override this.FinishSession : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the type of account to authenticate with, will never be null
a bundle of session data created by #startAddAccountSession used for adding account to device, or by #startUpdateCredentialsSession used for updating local credentials.
Docs.summary: Finishes the session started by #startAddAccountSession or #startUpdateCredentials by installing the account to device with AccountManager, or updating the local credentials.
Docs.returns:
a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_INTENT, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_NAME and AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_TYPE of the account that was added or local credentials were updated, and optional AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_STATUS_TOKEN for checking the status of the account later, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Checks if the removal of this account is allowed.

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the account to check, will never be null
an array of features to check, will never be null
Docs.summary: Checks if the account supports all the specified authenticator specific features.

a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_INTENT, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_BOOLEAN_RESULT, true if the account has all the features, false otherwise
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.OS.Bundle StartAddAccountSession (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType, string authTokenType, string[] requiredFeatures, Android.OS.Bundle options);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle StartAddAccountSession(class Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, string accountType, string authTokenType, string[] requiredFeatures, class Android.OS.Bundle options) cil managed

abstract member StartAddAccountSession : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * string * string * string[] * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle override this.StartAddAccountSession : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * string * string * string[] * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the type of account to authenticate with, will never be null
the type of auth token to retrieve after authenticating with the account, may be null
a String array of authenticator-specific features that the account authenticated with must support, may be null
a Bundle of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Docs.summary: Starts the add account session to authenticate user to an account of the specified accountType.
Docs.returns:
a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_INTENT, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_SESSION_BUNDLE for adding the account to device later, and if account is authenticated, optional AccountManager#KEY_PASSWORD and AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_STATUS_TOKEN for checking the status of the account, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error

format.a: Java documentation for android.accounts.AbstractAccountAuthenticator.startAddAccountSession(android.accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String[], android.os.Bundle).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.OS.Bundle StartUpdateCredentialsSession (Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, Android.Accounts.Account account, string authTokenType, Android.OS.Bundle options);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.OS.Bundle StartUpdateCredentialsSession(class Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse response, class Android.Accounts.Account account, string authTokenType, class Android.OS.Bundle options) cil managed

abstract member StartUpdateCredentialsSession : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * Android.Accounts.Account * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle override this.StartUpdateCredentialsSession : Android.Accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse * Android.Accounts.Account * string * Android.OS.Bundle -> Android.OS.Bundle

Docs.param: to send the result back to the AccountManager, will never be null
the account whose credentials are to be updated, will never be null
the type of auth token to retrieve after updating the credentials, may be null
a Bundle of authenticator-specific options, may be null
Docs.summary: Asks user to re-authenticate for an account but defers updating the locally stored credentials.
Docs.returns:
a Bundle result or null if the result is to be returned via the response. The result will contain either:
  • AccountManager#KEY_INTENT, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_SESSION_BUNDLE for updating the locally stored credentials later, and if account is re-authenticated, optional AccountManager#KEY_PASSWORD and AccountManager#KEY_ACCOUNT_STATUS_TOKEN for checking the status of the account later, or
  • AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_CODE and AccountManager#KEY_ERROR_MESSAGE to indicate an error

format.a: Java documentation for android.accounts.AbstractAccountAuthenticator.startUpdateCredentialsSession(android.accounts.AccountAuthenticatorResponse, android.accounts.Account, java.lang.String, android.os.Bundle).
